conclusion: Analyze magnetic flux through rotating loop and apply Faraday's law to determine induced EMF, then use Ohm's law for induced current, and calculate average induced EMF.
Rectangular loop abcd in uniform horizontal magnetic field, rotating around vertical axis coinciding with side cd at constant angular velocity ω. Magnetic induction is B, area is S.
Magnetic flux Φ through loop is area S multiplied by magnetic induction B. Initially, flux is maximum when loop is perpendicular to field.
Induced EMF ε is given by rate of change of magnetic flux: ε = -dΦ/dt = -S dB/dt. Since B is constant, ε = -S × B × ω × 60°/360° = -S × B × ω/6.
Using Ohm's law, induced current I is I = ε/R = S × B × ω/6R.
Average induced EMF over full rotation is 0 because positive and negative EMFs cancel each other.
Instantaneous value of induced current is I = S × B × ω/6R. Average value of induced EMF is 0.
